events.description: The release of Spain's industrial production data for December 2025, showing the first year-on-year decline in 10 months.

facts.fact_text: Spain’s industrial production fell by 0.3% year-on-year in December 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Spain’s industrial production fell by 0.3% year-on-year in December 2025

facts.fact_text: Industrial activity shrank by 2.5% on a seasonally adjusted monthly basis in December.

evidences.evidence_text: On a seasonally adjusted monthly basis, industrial activity shrank by 2.5% in December

facts.fact_text: Spanish industrial production grew by an average of 1.3% for the full year 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: For the year 2025 as a whole, Spanish industrial production grew by an average of 1.3%.

facts.fact_text: Output growth slowed for energy to 3.9% and non-durable consumer goods to 0.8%.

evidences.evidence_text: output growth slowed for energy (3.9% vs 7.4%) and non-durable consumer goods (0.8% vs 3.8%)

claims.claim_text: The industrial pullback was driven by declines in durable consumer goods, intermediate goods, and capital goods.

evidences.evidence_text: The pullback was driven by declines in durable consumer goods (-2% vs -3.3% in November); intermediate goods (-1.6% vs 3.2%) and capital goods (-0.8% vs 1.5%).

evidence.evidence_text: Spain’s industrial production fell by 0.3% year-on-year in December 2025, the first decrease since February 2025
The pullback was driven by declines in durable consumer goods
